caption: This photograph captures a serene aerial view of a lush, dense forest with a flock of white birds flying over it. The birds, possibly egrets or another type of large white bird, are spread across the frame in a loosely organized formation, offering a contrast of vivid white against the deep greens of the treetops below. The canopy of the forest appears thick and expansive, indicating a healthy, possibly tropical or subtropical environment. The image has a natural, wilderness quality, showcasing the beauty of undisturbed nature and its inhabitants. The perspective is from above, highlighting the spread and isolation of the birds against the uniform green background.
title: Roseate spoonbills in the western end of Everglades National Park
